name: 黃秀英
objective:
This course introduces the basic principles of the finite element method and its applications in various engineering problems. Topics include fundamental concepts of finite element analysis, establishing finite element models using variational principles, shape functions, and iso-parametric elements. It covers one-dimensional problems such as rods, trusses, beams, and frames; two-dimensional problems including plane stress, plane strain, and plate-shell problems; and three-dimensional problems involving general solids. Practical exercises and case studies using finite element analysis software are included for practice and research analysis.
  This semester, the course integrates USR (University Social Responsibility) into the curriculum, guiding students to apply finite element analysis to the USR project. Students who heavily participate in the USR project can utilize finite analysis in their USR electrical vehicle designs and/or for systematic improvements.
schedule:
1	Syllabus and Introduction (Ch1)-- A general overview of the course. The USR program is introduced into the class. Off-campus visits to county-side schools will be arranged. Students are encouraged to participate in the USR project. Guide students to apply finite element methods in the USR program.
2	One Dimensional Elements and Computational Procedures (Ch2) -- A USR car model for 3D printing is introduced for the coming Friday USR activities.
3	Basic Elements (Ch3) -- Use the USR electrical vehicle as a course exercise example.
4	Formulation Techniques: Variational Methods (Ch4)-- Introduce the design concept for electric vehicles using the finite element commercial codes for design analysis and improvement for the USR project.
5	Formulation Techniques: Galerkin and Other Weighted Residual Methods (Ch5)
6	Isoparametric Elements (Ch6) --USR vehicle design is scheduled for the coming Friday.
7	Isoparametric Triangles and Tetrahedra (Ch7)
8	Coordinate Transformation and Selected Analysis Options (Ch8), Define the semester project topics.  Report outline due next week
9	Review & Midterm Exam
10	Error Estimation and Convergence (Ch9), Student Midterm Exam  Evaluation–Arrange off-campus teaching to introduce USR program
11	Modeling Considerations and Software Use (Ch10)--Invite industry experts to share, and use the USR vehicle as an exercise example
12	Finite Elements in Structural Dynamics and Vibrations (Ch11)
13	Heat Transfer and Selected Fluid Problems (Ch12)
14	Constraints: Penalty Forms, Locking, and Constraint Counting (Ch13) & Solids of Revolution (Ch14)
15	Plate Bending (Ch15) & Shells (Ch16)
16	Nonlinearity: An Introduction (Ch17)
17	Project Presentation --Groups term project presentation, encourage students use USR vehicle for their project
18	Class Review & Final Exam-- After the final exam of the semester, field trips for USR program are arranged
